messages.message:
Hello -Not sure where to post this, so I am gonna toss it here (let me know where it _should_ live for next time :slightly_smiling_face: ).

What is the process to get a sandbox updated?  It seems that our version of the annotator is a fair bit outdated.  Specifically I am trying to update the anthem.aws.instabase.com (http://anthem.aws.instabase.com) sandbox.  I am not 100% sure who deployed the sandbox originally.  @Shubham Oli - I think you are my best guess.  Can you help out?
@Dan H yes, let me see what access we can provide you to directly update the sandbox without our help.
@shaunak - just wanted to check in on this one. Sorry for the last minute cry for help.  Anyway we can get me the proper access, or do a quick push before tomorrow 11AM ET?
Yes, I’ll ask Shubham to upgrade this today.  Sorry lots of escalations to handle and this slipped through.

Hey @Dan H

I’m updating the anthem sandbox to the latest release. For future reference you can refer this doc https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TI/pages/1213497394/Create+an+IB+Sandbox
to create and update a sandbox.
:thumbsup_all: @Shubham Oli can we make the release branch a drop down menu, or at least have the latest provided value be the latest release branch?
do we want latest release branch or master to be the default?
I would say latest release branch which is live in production
this will make life for SE and CS team’s much simpler.  The DEVs can choose whatever branch they want :slightly_smiling_face:

Hmm, but given that model-service/DL team is adding/fixing many new things vey fast this causes problem with the release branches as changes are not CPed from the master.

We tried this approach with few sandboxes but ended up re-deploying them with master as it contains the fix.

okay, I think we should optimize for the teams who are not aware of our internal githubs.  The eng team should be able to configure the way they like it, but we should make it _really_ simple for our non-eng teams to use t.
